Description: Each player has 5 Monster Zones (now Main Monster Zones plus Extra Monster Zone with Link format). This limits field presence strategically.

Description: Spell Cards have green borders. This color coding helps players quickly identify card types during gameplay.

Description: Effect Monster Cards have orange borders. Their effects can dramatically impact gameplay beyond just ATK/DEF stats.

Description: Stardust Dragon was the first Synchro Monster, debuting in the 5D's era booster 'The Duelist Genesis' in 2008. It became Yusei Fudo's ace monster.

Description: Xyz Monsters use materials (overlay units) instead of levels. They're summoned by overlaying two or more monsters of the same level, which become attached materials.

IncorrectAnswers: By tuning with a Tuner monster

Description: Synchro Summoning requires exactly one Tuner monster plus one or more non-Tuner monsters whose total Levels equal the Synchro Monster's Level.

Answers: One Tuner and non-Tuners whose Levels equal the Synchro Monster's Level
IncorrectAnswers: Two monsters of the same Level

Description: Link Monsters have no DEF stat and cannot be in Defense Position. Their Link Rating equals the number of Link Arrows they have, and they point to zones that become usable for Extra Deck monsters.
Question: What is unique about Link Monsters' defensive capabilities?
Answers: They have no DEF and cannot be in Defense Position

Description: Pendulum Monsters can be placed in Pendulum Zones (now Spell/Trap Zones) to enable Pendulum Summoning. When destroyed, they go face-up to the Extra Deck instead of the Graveyard.

Description: Effect Veiler is a Level 1 Tuner that can be discarded from hand during the opponent's Main Phase to negate a face-up monster's effects until end of turn.

Description: Maxx C lets you draw a card each time your opponent Special Summons. In the OCG it's Limited, but it's Forbidden in the TCG due to its power level.

Description: PSCT (Problem-Solving Card Text) was introduced in 2011 to standardize card text. Colons and semicolons separate costs, conditions, and effects clearly.
Question: What does PSCT stand for in Yu-Gi-Oh card text?

Description: In PSCT, text before a semicolon is a cost that must be paid at activation. Text between semicolon and colon is a condition. Text after the colon is the effect.
Question: In PSCT, what does text before a semicolon indicate?
Answers: A cost that must be paid at activation

Description: Tyler the Great Warrior was a one-of-a-kind card created for Tyler Gressle through the Make-A-Wish Foundation in 2005. It's the rarest card in existence.

Question: When was the first official Forbidden & Limited List released?

Description: Konami's UDE (Upper Deck Entertainment) lawsuit ended Upper Deck's license to distribute Yu-Gi-Oh cards in 2008. Konami then distributed directly.
Question: What company distributed Yu-Gi-Oh TCG in North America before Konami took over?

Description: Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon (LOB) was released in North America on March 8, 2002, launching the TCG in the West.
Question: What year did Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon release in North America?
RegExDescription: Accepts 2002 in numeric or word form

Description: Mystical Space Typhoon (MST) destroys a Spell/Trap Card. Contrary to popular belief, it does NOT negate effects—destruction and negation are different.
Question: Does Mystical Space Typhoon negate card effects?
Answers: No, it only destroys, it does not negate

Description: Royal Decree continuously negates all Trap Card effects on the field, including itself after it resolves. It doesn't prevent Trap Cards from being activated.
Question: What does Royal Decree do to Trap Cards?
Answers: Negates all Trap Card effects on the field

Description: Spell Speed 2 includes Quick-Play Spells, Normal/Continuous/Counter Trap Cards, and Quick Effects. They can respond to Spell Speed 1 or 2, but not Spell Speed 3.
Question: What Spell Speed are Quick-Play Spell Cards?

Description: Only Counter Trap Cards are Spell Speed 3. They can respond to any Spell Speed, and only other Counter Traps can chain to them.
Question: What is the only card type that is Spell Speed 3?

Description: Number 86: Heroic Champion - Rhongomyniad with 5+ materials cannot be destroyed, is unaffected by other effects, and prevents opponent from Normal/Special Summoning.
Question: How many materials does Number 86: Heroic Champion - Rhongomyniad need for its most powerful effects?

Description: Nibiru, the Primal Being can be Special Summoned from hand after opponent Special Summons 5+ times in a turn, tributing all face-up monsters on field.
Question: How many Special Summons must the opponent perform before Nibiru can activate?

Description: Super Polymerization is a Quick-Play Spell that Fusion Summons using materials from either side of the field. Its activation and effect cannot be responded to.
Question: What makes Super Polymerization unique compared to regular Polymerization?
Answers: Cannot be responded to and uses opponent's monsters as materials

Description: Duel Links launched on November 17, 2016 in Japan and January 11, 2017 worldwide. It uses a unique Speed Duel format with 4000 LP and smaller fields.
Question: When did Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links globally release?

Description: Gate Guardian's combined ATK of 3750 represents Sanga (2600), Kazejin (2400), and Suijin (2500), but the card itself is a single 3750 ATK monster.
Question: What is Gate Guardian's ATK?
